title: Unit 5 Checkpoint: Analytical Applications of Differentiation
description: Big unit exam + at least 2 full FRQs. This is the largest unit (15-18% of AP exam). Covers MVT/EVT, increasing/decreasing, extrema, concavity, curve sketching, and optimization.

remediationStrategy.description: Critical unit — students must master these skills before integration. Focused reteaching on weak clusters.

clusters.reteachFocus: Stating hypotheses and conclusion, MVT justification writing
Sign charts, First Derivative Test, Candidates Test
f'' sign analysis, Second Derivative Test, connecting f/f'/f'' graphs
Setup: objective + constraint, reduce variables, check endpoints

assessmentProblems.question: Verify MVT applies to f(x) = x³ - 3x on [0, 2], then find all c values guaranteed by MVT.
Find the intervals where f(x) = x⁴ - 4x³ + 10 is increasing and decreasing. Find all local extrema.
assessmentProblems.answer: f'(x) = 4x³ - 12x² = 4x²(x-3). Critical points: x=0, x=3. Sign chart: f'<0 on (-∞,0), f'<0 on (0,3), f'>0 on (3,∞). Decreasing on (-∞,3), increasing on (3,∞). At x=0: no sign change → no extremum. At x=3: f'changes - to + → local min. f(3) = 81-108+10 = -17.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the intervals of concavity and inflection points of f(x) = x⁴ - 4x³ + 10.

(FRQ) The graph of f' (not f) is given: f' is positive and decreasing on (0,2), crosses zero at x=2, negative on (2,5), has a minimum at x=3.5, and crosses zero again at x=5. (a) Where does f have local extrema? (b) Where is f concave up? (c) Where does f have inflection points?
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) f'=0 at x=2 (changes +→-) → local max. f'=0 at x=5 (changes -→+) → local min. (b) f concave up where f' is increasing: (3.5, 5+). (c) f'' = 0 where f' has extrema: inflection at x=3.5 (f' changes from decreasing to increasing, so f'' changes sign).

assessmentProblems.question: Find the absolute maximum and minimum of f(x) = x³ - 6x² + 9x + 1 on [0, 4].
assessmentProblems.answer: f'(x) = 3x²-12x+9 = 3(x-1)(x-3). Critical: x=1, x=3 (both in [0,4]). Evaluate: f(0)=1, f(1)=1-6+9+1=5, f(3)=27-54+27+1=1, f(4)=64-96+36+1=5. Absolute max: 5 at x=1 and x=4. Absolute min: 1 at x=0 and x=3.

assessmentProblems.question: A farmer has 300 feet of fencing and wants to enclose a rectangular area next to a river (no fence needed along the river). Find the dimensions that maximize the area.
assessmentProblems.answer: Let x = side perpendicular to river (two of these), y = side parallel. Constraint: 2x+y=300 → y=300-2x. Objective: A = xy = x(300-2x) = 300x-2x². A'=300-4x=0 → x=75. y=300-150=150. A''=-4<0 → max. Dimensions: 75ft × 150ft. Max area: 11,250 ft².

assessmentProblems.question: (FRQ) A particle moves along the x-axis with velocity v(t) = t² - 5t + 4 for t ≥ 0. (a) Find all times when the particle changes direction. (b) Find the acceleration at t = 3. (c) Is the particle speeding up or slowing down at t = 3? Justify.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) v(t)=(t-1)(t-4)=0 at t=1, t=4. Sign changes at both → direction changes at t=1 and t=4. (b) a(t)=2t-5. a(3)=6-5=1. (c) v(3)=9-15+4=-2<0. a(3)=1>0. v and a have opposite signs → slowing down.

assessmentProblems.question: SPIRAL: Use L'Hôpital's Rule to evaluate lim(x→0) (x - sin x)/x³.
assessmentProblems.answer: 0/0. L'Hôpital: (1-cos x)/(3x²) → 0/0. Again: sin x/(6x) → 0/0. Again: cos x/6 → 1/6.

answerKeys.cu5-2: Decreasing (-∞,3), increasing (3,∞). Local min at (3,-17). No extremum at x=0.
answerKeys.cu5-4: (a) Max at x=2, min at x=5 (b) (3.5,5+) (c) x=3.5
answerKeys.cu5-5: Max=5 at x=1,4. Min=1 at x=0,3.
